summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting the court to preclude the government from introducing alleged co-conspirator statements at trial. The motion argues the government failed to comply with a September 3, 2021 court order requiring disclosure of co-conspirator identities and statements by October 11, 2021, and instead provided massive document dumps without specific identification.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose attorneys are filing this motion to preclude evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified by the government as a purported co-conspirator; described as deceased and unavailable to testify.

events.title: Court Order for Disclosure
events.description: The court issued an order requiring the government to disclose identities of unnamed co-conspirators and all co-conspirator statements it intends to offer at trial by October 11, 2021.

events.title: Government Disclosure Deadline
events.description: Deadline for government to comply with the court's September 3 order by disclosing co-conspirator identities and statements.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Preclude
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files this motion to preclude co-conspirator statements, arguing the government failed to properly comply with the disclosure order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government identified Jeffrey Epstein and two other unnamed individuals as purported co-conspirators for trial purposes.

The defense argues the government failed to properly disclose specific co-conspirator statements as ordered, instead providing massive document dumps containing hundreds of thousands of statements from seized electronic devices.

The motion claims the government's failure to disclose prevents adequate defense preparation and cross-examination, particularly since the alleged co-conspirators (including the deceased Epstein) are unavailable to testify.
The defense seeks preclusion of all alleged co-conspirator statements as a sanction for the government's failure to comply with the court's disclosure order.
